title: PSA to all top-laners: help your jungler out level 1
body:
This isn't a "leash me" post. This is a "watch our buff" post.

Simply watching your jungler's buff does several things that grant you a great fucking advantage:

1. **You have narrowed down where the enemy jungler can possibly be.** You now know they aren't taking your team's camp and won't be ganking you from behind. If they're trying to take it (or are taking it) then you have eyes exactly on where they are and can play accordingly.

2. **Your jungler is kept from being put behind.** Your team can be aware if the enemy jungler is trying to steal their buff and react accordingly, meaning your jungler can go take the enemy's buff in return immediately instead of having to guess where they need to be. This prevents them losing an exorbitant amount of gold and experience and so keeps them on the same level of the enemy jungler, meaning you also benefit.

3. **You can potentially put the enemy jungler behind.** If the enemy jungler walks up to try and take the buff and you're guarding it, you can take some free hits from him. Lower health means the jungler has to play more conservatively. The enemy jungler being forced to back off from taking the buff also means they have to walk back to their own, costing them both time and pressure.

Watching your jungler's buff offers all these things at the cost of _nothing_ - it takes absolutely _nothing_ from you to do this besides at _most_ your first ward if you don't want to stand watch until 1:30.

You want to know the best part about this?

#This does not cost you any minions or any minion waves.

Walking to top lane from top-side buff while leaving at 1:30 (even up to 1:35) puts you back at top-lane before any minions can even be killed. There's still more than 10 seconds to spare even. That is a fucking _massive_ margin for error.

This is called **being a good teammate**. It's called **playing with and for your team**. It's a practice in consideration for your teammates on top of just flat out increasing your chances at winning.

So be a good player. Watch your jungler's buff.

As a top laner I always gaurd my JG's toplane buff and ward it at 1:25.  However, I HATE HATE HATE junglers who demand a leash from their toplaner, GO BOTLANE DUMBASS, the leash is FASTER, You lose less HP, and NO ONE GETS PUT BEHIND BECAUSE OF IT.   

Junglers who leash toplane are inconsiderate idiots: Change my mind.
Fiddlesticks on blue side. Amumu as well.

neither of those jg's NEED to start blue buff, also both those Jg's have a SLOW clear on the 1st buff, which means they would benefit more from the 2man leash damage from botlane (or would keep their toplaner out of lane longer potentially setting them back).


Amumu especially can start red, taking E and W first and then easily clear raptors 2nd, and still have fine mana to do blue buff.  Having an ap jungler is not an excuse to set your toplaner back, you arent going to go OOM after 2 camps and you can easily take your blue buff 3rd or 2nd.

It's much less about the slow clear or what's fastest - it's a lot more that those two champions are examples of champs with "INVADE ME" stamped on them in neon letters. They don't need blue to clear their first camps, no - but if they get invaded and lose their blue, those champs have next to no options left. Starting it is the most guaranteed way for them to be able to ensure they get it.

If you've ever been a mana hungry jungler and had your blue taken from you, then you'd know that you are basically the kid they put on milk cartons because nobody will see you for a very, very long time.

It's not always about which buff to start, also need to consider being unpredictable so you dont get counter jungled or invaded. 
Top start lets you split the map vertically in the worst case scenario, which can lead to best case of getting a 3 quadrant jg clear open vs their single which puts you ahead massively if they didnt scout properly. This is not possible if you always start bot side

> Junglers who leash toplane are inconsiderate idiots: Change my mind.

Your jungler should be able to choose where they start; it's not your call.

Given the margin for error, a top laner can throw out 5-ish (depending on champion) autos with 0 risk and losing 0 CS. Even if you lose a single creep, it's still worth the trade to the advantage your jungle gains.

Why do this?

Simple: To avoid the enemy jungler. Junglers who have poor early dueling can (generally) go top buff > top scuttle > farm jungle and not be behind the enemy duelist jungle, while actually not leashing them.

Junglers who CAN duel early can also abuse it. Going top buff > enemy top buff > top lane / top scuttle is my favorite route on Olaf, and there's literally nothing the enemy jungler can do about it, because he beats the shit out of enemy of them in an early duel. On Rek'sai I prefer to start the enemy buff and immediately gank top lane, securing my top laner first blood kill / assist and setting them massively ahead, so that I (hopefully) tilt the enemy laner level 1 never have to go top alone.

Helping your jungler leash is always worth it, they gain so much more out of it than you could ever possibly lose.

I agree.

But there's a corollary.  

The corollary here is that as a toplaner, I will often blow many resources to help protect my jungler from invades, etc., and then they just crap the bed and never help apply topside pressure at all until I've been ganked multiple times and inevitably succumb.  I just lost a game this week where I literally blew Tele to help strongly repel an enemy invade so I could get back to lane - I did okay even being a wave late to lane, but then I got ganked multiple times while our jungler literally never did anything but camps even after his counterpart had ganked all over the map.

It makes me want to never protect buffs or risk being late to lane, but I know that's not good courtesy to junglers who *do* their parts.

So take care of your top laner, too.  Help them out - if they leashed you, try to gank them early to make up for the loss of lane pressure.  Don't let them become a walking bag of gold if the other jungler is farming them while you idly do camps and pick mushrooms in the forest.

I hate the overuse of "PSA" and "Agency" on these boards, however I have to agree. 

All too often the top laner will just sit under turret and AFK twiddle their knob while they wait for their slow ass minion wave to get to lane. So then I have to assume that any of the myriad of early invade junglers that are meta right now (due to the early level 2-3 duelist meta around scuttle) don't use a single braincell more than what is required to right click and smite, and not drop a deep ward on the top part of the top-side buff niche. Which would allow them to see that not a single fuck is given about the enemy team jungler (me).

Just so people know, it is entirely viable for a jungler to kill Red or Blue buff at level 1, unassisted, by using smite and basic kiting techniques. This will put them behind a bit in the way of clear times, but now they have red buff they've taken a large chunk of your Jungle's EXP & DPS across the board. 

When/if this happens, don't expect me to gank top lane, and don't expect me to sympathize with "Top lane most innocent lane, pls gank" posts you see all the time here.

I often cheese start enemy red and gank lvl 2 top and tell bot "ward red after second wave". What I mostly get is either no ward a ward when they directly walk to lane which expires when the enemy enters my jungler.
Sad that this needs to be a PSA, being useful iinstead of afk at turret doing nothing level 1....

> Walking to top lane from top-side buff while leaving at 1:30 (even up to 1:35) puts you back at top-lane before any minions can even be killed. There's still more than 10 seconds to spare even. That is a fucking massive margin for error.

This is not correct though.  The margin for error in top is very small, and you make the incorrect assumption that just because someone can walk a direct line back to a wounded minion wave in that time that it makes no difference in lane pressure or CS.  Some champs and situations require you to be at the wave several seconds before the first melee minions even touch each other in order to have the best chance of a hard lane win.  And really good toplaners can and will use even the smallest difference in lane pressure to snowball (especially if you don't plan on coming back top to reciprocate the help or get tangled up elsewhere), and that includes wave health.

I routinely try to hold the small bush in the topside river early as a lookout, and from there make my way up top.  I'd say I'm fine with watching your second buff until about 1:15-1:20 in publics.   But asking for my free ward is dicey, especially if you can't promise help later, and probably earlier than you think I need to be able to patrol the top area, decide if I want an early ward in the tri or river, and decide if I need subtle lane pressure/harassment if necessary - especially in publics.  

In flex or with people I know have my back I'll do much more than this, but the risk in soloQ of selfishness is way too high.  I can't be even a little late to my lane in a soloQ game as a top laner if my jungle doesn't have my back -  and some soloQ junglers definitely don't have my back, just as some toplaners haven't had yours.
